intro: Ricotia carnosula, commonly known as the fat-leafed ricotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Ricotia carnosula is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
